title-group.article-title: Optimum Design of a Ceramic Turbine Wheel

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright Â© Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc., 1977

abstract.p: Optimum turbine wheel geometry for passenger car gas turbine has been calculated for two ceramic materials: hot pressed silicon nitride and densified silicon carbide. Two iterative strategies, coupling the mathematical programming techniques with methods of finite elements and finite differences, were used for finding disk with minimum failure probability. The influences of mean strength, Weibull modulus, and the disk form on the failure probability are presented. The results distinctly show that an improvement in material quality is necessary if the ceramic gas turbine wheel is to become a dependable component.
